resources.string: This method is not recommended when mirroring to wireless displays
To protect your device, SecondScreen will not allow you to use this resolution and/or density value.
Multiple versions of SecondScreen are installed on your device. Only one version may be installed at a time.\n\nPress Uninstall to remove the duplicate version, then reload the app.
Checking for superuser access… please wait.
Cannot delete the currently active profile

SecondScreen: better screen mirroring for Android devices

© %d Braden Farmer
App logo by mayowadavid

• Connect your display first, if you have not already done so.

• Make sure you've granted root/adb access to SecondScreen - otherwise, it won't do anything.

• Hang tight for a few seconds as your device changes its resolution and density!

• When the SecondScreen icon appears in the status bar, your device is ready to use.

• For best results, connect any Bluetooth devices after the profile is finished loading.

• When you're finished using your display, select the Turn Off option in the notification.
%1$s is currently active. Would you like to turn it off?
You\'ve left your UI refresh method as \"Do nothing\". Selecting a UI refresh method is highly recommended when changing your resolution and/or density.\n\nSave anyway?
SecondScreen has not been tested on this version of Android. It may stop working completely or behave in other unexpected ways.\n\nCheck for app updates if you see any issues.
This is the currently active profile. Would you like to reload it to apply your changes?

Expert mode overrides SecondScreen\'s internal blacklist of unsafe resolution and density combinations. Only use this option if you know exactly what you are doing. Safe mode is strongly recommended when using this option.\n\nReally enable expert mode?
Allow any user-defined value to be set for resolution and density

This app requires elevated permissions to operate! As with all apps of this nature, improper use may potentially render your device unusable.

This app is intended for devices with AOSP or Google experience ROMs only! It is not guaranteed to function properly on devices with manufacturer-skinned ROMs.

By pressing Accept, you acknowledge that you are SOLELY held responsible for how you use this app, for the type of device you use it on, and for the methods of obtaining elevated permissions on your device.
Start SecondScreen when connecting a display

SecondScreen appears to have been restored from a backup.\n\nIf this is a different device, please clear app data and re-run SecondScreen to ensure that it operates correctly (otherwise, problems may occur).
Profiles will not stay active after a reboot
Tap a profile name to view or load its settings.\nCreate additional profiles using the plus button.
The highlighted profile below is currently active.\nTap its name to view its settings or turn it off.
Use Quick Actions to access SecondScreen functionality without creating a new profile, or temporarily modify an existing running profile without editing it.
Profile not found!\n\nPlease recreate or delete this shortcut.
Tap the plus button to create your first profile
Useful for older TVs that crop parts of the image
Automatically enable Bluetooth (to connect a keyboard, mouse, and/or game controller)
Show the screensaver when device is locked (wired connections only)
Show visual feedback for touchscreen events
Dim the device\'s backlight as much as possible while a display is connected
Disable the device\'s vibration motor as much as possible
Always show desktop sites in the Chrome browser
Show the navigation bar for devices with physical buttons (only works on CyanogenMod ROMs)
Open apps in floating, resizeable windows
Note: Overscan values assume that the display is in landscape orientation, and are only accurate while the profile is active.
Please ensure that Daydreams is fully configured (in the system display settings) before loading this profile.
Continue using the active overscan values?
You are now %1$d steps away from enabling debug mode.
Debug mode enabled\nTap to disable debug mode

Due to limitations in this version of Android, Busybox needs to be installed in order for SecondScreen to properly refresh the UI.\n\nIt is strongly recommended to either install Busybox or upgrade to a newer version of Android.
SecondScreen requires permission to modify system settings before it can continue.\n\nPlease press \"Grant Permission\" and ensure that SecondScreen is set to \"Allow modify system settings\"
Freeform mode requires a UI refresh method to be selected
Freeform mode requires a reboot to take effect
Show an on-screen overlay with recent apps and start menu, for a PC-like experience

SecondScreen needs optional permission to \"draw over other apps\" in order to force other installed apps to run in landscape mode.\n\nIf you don\'t grant permission, SecondScreen can still lock the device\'s orientation to landscape, but some apps will still run in portrait mode.
Please reboot your device for SecondScreen to apply settings

SecondScreen uses elevated permissions to change device settings, such as resolution and density. These permissions are granted either through root access, or by running an adb shell command.

Please do one of the following:

• Root your device. If your device is already rooted, then ensure that SecondScreen is allowed superuser permissions.

• Connect your device to a computer with the Android SDK installed, and run the following command (one line):

Unfortunately, due to OEM restrictions, this feature can't be enabled on your device.

You may still be able to enable it by using this adb shell command:

appops set %1$s %2$s allow
Use Taskbar as the default launcher if it\'s installed; otherwise, clear the default launcher
Please unplug and replug your HDMI cable for this setting to take effect

By selecting this input method, SecondScreen can disable your soft keyboard, if it still shows up while a hardware keyboard is attached.\n\nA notification will appear in the status bar when this input method is active. Tap it to change back to your previous keyboard.
Allow the backlight to turn off without a display connected
Allows SecondScreen to turn off the device\'s screen
Allows SecondScreen to turn off the device\'s screen.\n\nThis will require you to deactivate SecondScreen as a device administrator prior to uninstalling.

In order to lock your device\'s screen, SecondScreen needs to be activated as a device administrator. This permission is used only to lock the screen, and for no other purpose.\n\nIf you choose to activate this, you will need to deactivate SecondScreen as a device administrator prior to uninstalling.
Apply a workaround on devices with screen notches to improve display output
This setting will take effect the next time a profile is loaded
Auto-start enabled, waiting for display connections…

Leaving safe mode on is strongly recommended.\n\nDisabling this option allows SecondScreen to stay active across reboots. Only disable this option if you know how to restore your device\'s resolution and density settings via adb if something goes wrong.
